words.name: Cheyenne
words.definition: The mountain under which NORAD is located.
words.example: ___ is where the fictional SGC is located.

words.name: Appropriate
words.definition: suitable, proper, just right
words.example: One should use ___ force when engaging the enemy.

words.name: Obnoxious
words.definition: nasty, disagreeable.
words.example: That dude is such an ___ jackass.

words.name: Nocturnality
words.definition: When an animal's primary activities take place during nighttime.
words.example: The owl is known for its ___

words.name: Manageable
words.definition: adj. not too difficult or big to attempt.
words.example: You should divide up your project into ___ chunks.

words.name: Dichotomy
words.definition: noun. Two things represented as something the opposite or different from each other.
words.example: You're setting up a false ___ where none exists.

words.name: Enthusiasm
words.definition: noun. Enjoyment and interest in a given subject.
words.example: My ___ for the game runs low.

words.name: Peculiar
words.definition: adj. odd
words.example: A ___ man came in town driving a clown car.

words.name: Explanation
words.definition: noun. The reason the way or how something is
words.example: The ___ for how car engines work is unclear.

words.name: Catastrophic
words.definition: adj. extreme failure
words.example: Even a tiny flaw in a rocket can result in a ___ event known as Rapid Unplanned Diassembly.

words.name: Laboratory
words.definition: n. a facility designed for scientific and techological research.
words.example: In Dexter's __, a child prodigy hid a ___ from his parents.

words.name: Nitinol
words.definition: n. an alloy of titanium and nickel.
words.example: Four applications for the alloy ___ includes 'Superelasticity', 'work production', 'constrained recovery', and 'free recovery'.

words.name: Hygiene
words.definition: n. health condition and set of practices for maintaining one's health.
words.example: American high school started too early, reducing the overall sleep ___ of the population, and thus resulting in lower performance.

words.name: Suppressive fire
words.definition: n. The concept of temporarily rendering an enemy ineffective with the use of weaponry so that they can be eliminated more easily.
words.example: In ground warfare, most of weapon fire is geared toward ___ rather than outright taking out the target.

words.name: Substantially
words.definition: adverb. In great amount, important, as opposed to minor or only slightly.
words.example: In the last ten years, nobody had advanced spaceflight as ___ as SpaceX.

words.name: Preliminary
words.definition: adjective. An initial action that prepare for something larger.
words.example: A ___ investigation has been conducted, but revealed nothing yet. More investigation and time is needed.

words.name: Obsolescence
words.definition: n. The eventual condition of becoming unwanted, useless, or unnecessary.
words.example: Some people alleged that manufacturers conspire in a process called planned ___ to keep us buying new goods.

words.name: Logarithm
words.definition: n. The power needed to raise a number exponentionally to produce a third number.
words.example: The ___ of 100 is 2.

words.name: Intricacy
words.definition: n. Highly detailed, complicated.
words.example: If you dive deep enough into a subject, you will find that the ___ of the subject keeps getting deeper.

words.name: Pragmatic
words.definition: adj. Realistic. Goal driven.
words.example: The congresscritters these days are less hard-nosed and ___ these days, unwilling to compromise and more willing to stand up for their ideology.

words.name: Spurious
words.definition: adj. Not actually true or fake.
words.example: Those claims are ___ and false.

words.name: Plagiarize
words.definition: verb. Taking someone's work and claiming it as one's own.
words.example: To ___ is much worse than copying or pirating a work. Copying usually preserves attribution and is sometime outright benefical. ___ is to steal credits.

words.name: Architecture
words.definition: n. The designs of buildings.
words.example: The Sydney Opera House is a fine example of ___.

words.name: Dyslexia
words.definition: n. A type of learning disorder associated with reading and writing.
words.example: If you can't spell, it may be because you have ___

words.name: Penchant
words.definition: n. A fondness and habit to do something.
words.example: That woman has a ___ for randomly baking cookies for someone.

words.name: Gladiatorial
words.definition: adj. relating to mortal combat in the style of Romian blood sport.
words.example: The battlebot TV series featured non-sentient ___ robots fighting to the death.

words.name: Sentient
words.definition: adj. The ability or capability of a lifeform to experience or feel.
words.example: I am a ___ lifeform.

words.name: Conglomerate
words.definition: Several distinct businesses combined into a single company
words.example: Samsung is an example of a ___

words.name: Paradigm
words.definition: n. A set of ideas and thought about something.
words.example: The ___ of behavorism is outmoded in the field of psychology.

words.name: Nostalgic
words.definition: adj. A feeling from long ago.
words.example: Remember the Command and Conquer series, particularly Red Alert? I am getting ___ about it.

words.name: Reminiscing
words.definition: verb. Remembering the good old time.
words.example: ___ about my high school days for old time's sake is counterproductive.

words.name: Cerebral
words.definition: adj. Relating to using or requiring your intelligence.
words.example: A lot of people think Interstellar is a ___ movie, but all it did was made me think about its plotholes.

words.name: Restaurant
words.definition: noun. A place of business in which you purchase a meal and dine.
words.example: Of all ___, buffets give you the most bang for your buck.

words.name: Ludicrous
words.definition: adj. Completely unreasonable or ridiculous
words.example: Activate ___ speed for faster than light travel!

words.name: Coherent
words.definition: adj. making sense.
words.example: You do not have a ___ theory to explain how the government is behind the 9/11 terrorist attack.

words.name: Leviathan
words.definition: noun. any large sea monster or creature.
words.example: A whale could be considered a ___

words.name: Arbitrary
words.definition: adj. random and unpredictable, perhaps unrestrained.
words.example: This rule is ___ as it lacks clear definition as to what is allowed and not allowed.

words.name: Copacetic
words.definition: adj. Well, 100% ready, or simply OK.
words.example: I am ___, thank you. Though I could just say I'm fine.

words.name: Arithmetic
words.definition: noun. The oldest and the most basic branch of mathematics dealing with numbers.
words.example: Adding an substracting numbers is part of the mathematical branch ___.

words.name: Reticule
words.definition: noun. Found in eyepieces, markings such as cross-hatches or grids that aid the user in measuring and aligning in an optical instrument.
words.example: A sniper looks through his ___ to line up a fatal shot.

words.name: Pasteurization
words.definition: noun. The process by which a food product becomes safer by heating.
words.example: The process of ___ isn't intended to kill all pathogens, but rather to reduce their numbers.

words.name: Caterpillar
words.definition: noun. The larvae form of a butterfly or a moth
words.example: The ___ will someday transforms into a butterfly or a moth.

words.name: Larva
words.definition: noun. Juveniles which are distinct from adult stages before undergoing metamorphosis.
words.example: The caterpillar is a ___ of a moth or butterfly.

words.name: Juvenile
words.definition: noun. Young or immature version of an adult
words.example: ___ in human societies are prevented from exercising rights that adult possessed.

words.name: Epitome
words.definition: noun. The perfect or defining example of something.
words.example: Elon Musk is the ___ of hard work, luck, and perseveration in the face of great difficulty.

words.name: Perseveration
words.definition: noun. The process of trying or repeating something, often in the face of difficulty.
words.example: ___ is key to succeeding in many area of life, especially when the going gets tough.

words.name: Spaghetti
words.definition: noun. Like noodles, but with pasta
words.example: Code tend to devolves into a spaghetti mess if the programmer don't take care.
